intro: Stenotheca mariana, commonly known as the Florida starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Stenotheca mariana is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
